thread.title: VIDEO: Pochettino takes part in free-kick challenge
thread.title_full: VIDEO: Pochettino takes part in free-kick challenge

title: VIDEO: Pochettino takes part in free-kick challenge
text:
0 24 Jan 2017 00:46:14 The Spurs boss took on his goalkeeping coach in a training ground exercise, but unfortunately came out on the losing side 
Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino has plenty of players capable of finding the target in his squad, having scored 45 goals so far this season in the Premier League. 
Spurs are the third highest scoring side in the English top-flight, so whatever Pochettino is showing them on the training ground is clearly working. 
Pogba trolled by hilarious Stoke post 
However, from the evidence of his free-kick challenge against goalkeeping coach Toni Jiminez, he may not be teaching his players how to take free-kicks. 
Pochettino was a centre-back in his playing days, scoring just 26 times in over 500 league appearances, so was never known for his finishing touch. 
The Spurs boss took on the coach, but saw himself come out on the losing side in a fun video from Tottenham training. Mauricio Pochettino v Toni Jimenez (goalkeeping coach) - who wins?? pic.twitter.com/cyXgrW4WcR â€” Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) January 23, 2017 
Tottenham are currently third in the Premier League table, but sit nine points behind leaders Chelsea. Related
